originalText.text:
I have been going to the Health Center at Hudson Yards for about two years now. Before that my Primary Care Physician was at Weill Cornell and when she switched to the health center I was reluctant to follow her.  I'm so very glad I did. On the one hand Amanda Carmel is the most remarkable PCP I've had in my 78 years. She is thoroughly caring in the profound sense of that word, listens to all you have to say, runs through all possibilities that your symptoms might suggest, asks you to contribute to the conversation, and always makes certain you get all the time with her you need and all the care you need from others as well. She has several times, in difficult moments, followed up with me by calling,  even late at night, to ask how I was doing, something I've never experienced with any other doctor--

The Health Center is a totally different medical experience from anything I had known previously. Everyone there is friendly, helpful, cheerful--and beyond that efficient and knowledgeable in whatever role they play. You never have a wait. You never place a question that is not followed up. One has the sense of remarkable medical intelligence combined with a respect for the patient which is thoroughly unusual.

When the covid vaccine became available to my age group in January 2020, they called me and found an appointment for me on the first day.  Let that example stand for the excellence of their service and their devotion to their patients.

originalText.text:
Practice seems discriminatory and their Doctors are in an exclusive members only service for the rich. This is absolutely abhorrent and immoral.

It appears that a response from the “owner” was posted 4 months from my initial post is filled with inaccuracies and misinformation. I did experience the aforementioned since I was denied the “speciality care” that you applaud yourselves for since my insurance is not accepted nor could I afford a $100,000 member service.

Please fact check your information before publishing.

originalText.text: i saw a orthopedist here, he misdiagnosed me with a minor ankle sprain, in reality it was fractured, and has been causing issues of months. now i have to have surgery.
